title: Ticket #7587: condor_history -af:j broken if ClusterId and ProcId not in attr list
description:
From a support ticket: 

$ condor_history -match 20 -constraint 'LastRemoteHost == "slot1@prc-microway.twk.us.ray.com"' -af:j requestmemory memoryusage
512 733
8192 47
8192 44
8192 74
8192 74

$ condor_history -match 20 -constraint 'LastRemoteHost == "slot1@prc-microway.twk.us.ray.com"' -af:j clusterid procid requestmemory memoryusage
41353.0 41353 0 512 733
43004.0 43004 0 8192 47
43008.0 43008 0 8192 44
43005.0 43005 0 8192 74
42996.0 42996 0 8192 74

As you can see, this somewhat defeats the purpose of -af:j. The condor_q command works as expected. The condor_history code should request the ClusterId and ProcId internally when autoformat:j is specified.
remarks:
2020-Apr-10 14:24:02 by johnkn:
No repro on the head of the 8.8 branch, this is either not a real but or it was already fixed.
creator: zmiller
